channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Epstein File Drop Is Not About Justice
item.description: The fight was supposed to be about releasing them. But the way it’s being done seems designed to obscure the truth.

item.title: GDP data confirms the Gen Z nightmare: the era of jobless growth is here
item.description: "I've never seen anything like it," KPMG's chief economist Diane Swonk told Fortune.

item.title: Obama’s former top economic advisor says he feels ‘a tiny bit bad’ for Trump because gas prices are low, but consumer confidence is still plummeting
item.description: “Consumers are just in this, whatever the highest price is, is the price they're going to focus on,” Harvard professor Jason Furman said.

item.title: The Strange Death of Make America Great Again
item.description: Trump has begun to recede from the movement he created.

item.title: Millionaire tax plans spread as Washington state eyes new levy
item.description: Democrats across the US are increasingly exploring taxes as a way to capture the populist moment and address the country’s widening wealth gap.

item.title: The Strange Case of the Russian Snickers in U.K. Convenience Shops
item.description: The Russian-labeled candy bars are a reminder of how difficult it is to completely disconnect a major economy from the global flow of goods.

item.title: Zelensky Open to Pulling Back Troops in Eastern Ukraine to Reach Peace Deal With Russia
item.description: The offer was the closest Mr. Zelensky has come to addressing the thorny territorial disputes in Donetsk that have repeatedly derailed peace talks.
